Common Symptoms: COMMON SYMPTOMS Fever Cough General malaise Loss of taste or smell UN COMMON SYMPTOMS: Sore throat Headache Diarrhea Skin rash Irritated eyes SYMPTOMS - COMPLICATIONS: Difficulty breathing or dyspnea Lethargy Chest pain
How is COVID 19 transmitted to people?: Direct contact, transmission by air and by droplets.
How mask help: Avoiding transmission by direct contact, transmission by air and by droplets
Reuse mask: The use of a mask depends on the individual's site of exposure, preferably they should be use surgical masks or disposable KN95.
Time get infected: A range of 5 to 10 days with a common average of 7 days.
What is vaccination: Immunization is the process by which a person becomes immune or resistant to an infectious disease, usually through the administration of a vaccine. Vaccines stimulate the body's own immune system to protect the person against infection or disease. later. WHO
when mask: Whenever we are in contact with another person.
when medical attention: Medical attention should be sought according to the symptoms in the different levels of health care.
why not vaccinate: They must be vaccinated since it is one of the most effective procedures for the prevention of infectious diseases.
why recommend vaccine: It is one of the most effective procedures for the prevention of infectious diseases, such as COVID-19

Common Symptoms: Headache General weakness Cough Loss of smell and taste Vomiting Difficulty breathing
Discomfort while vaccinate: Yes, in the second vaccination I had a fever and muscle pain.
How is COVID 19 transmitted to people?: Through indirect or direct contact with secretions infected by the virus.
How mask help: They prevent the transfer of contaminated secretions from one person to another.
What is vaccination: It is the process of acquired immunization, defense antibodies against the virus.
when mask: All the time when leaving home.
when medical attention: When the first symptoms have appeared and you suspect that you have been in contact with a positive COVID-19 patient.
why not vaccinate: Yes, they must be vaccinated, to stop the infections in the population.
why recommend vaccine: There is no risk when getting vaccinated, vaccination is the most important preventive measure both for personal care

Common Symptoms: Flu-like symptoms plus loss of taste and smell. Also pain in the lung area and shortness of breath
How is COVID 19 transmitted to people?: By air with virus particles present in the environment and less frequently with virus particles on surfaces
How mask help: They prevent transmission to a certain extent if we have the virus by blocking a good part of the particles that we emit that may contain the virus. If one does not have the virus, it helps to avoid the entry of similar particles to the mouth or nose.
Reuse mask: Yes it is possible but only to a certain extent depending on the type of mask for a limited time, but it is not advisable.
Time get infected: About 3 to 4 days, but it can take up to 2 weeks
What is vaccination: The procedure for inoculating people with viruses or variants of genetic material to achieve antibody resistance
when mask: Especially in closed public places, but it is also useful in outdoor public places
when medical attention: If symptoms such as shortness of breath or lack of oxygenation occur
why not vaccinate: You should be vaccinated to prevent the spread of a disease or lessen symptoms in the event of contracting a disease. In addition to eventually eradicating the disease
why recommend vaccine: To prevent them from spreading or to end the pandemic

Discomfort while vaccinate: Yes. General malaise, fever, myalgia, headache.
How is COVID 19 transmitted to people?: It is transmitted by respiratory droplets that contain the virus.
How mask help: It is a barrier method that prevents virus particles from coming into contact with the respiratory tract.
Reuse mask: No, each mask has a useful life time
Time get infected: It can take between 2 to 14 days.
What is vaccination: It is the process by which a vaccine is administered so that a person or animal becomes resistant or immune to a disease.
when mask: When we are in public places where social distancing cannot be maintained.
when medical attention: Having a very high fever that does not settle to medication, having significant dyspnea.
why not vaccinate: People who have an allergy to any of the components of the vaccine or a state of immunosuppression should not be vaccinated without the permission of their treating physician.
why recommend vaccine: It is the only effective way to stop pandemics.
